Name: Statistical region
Description: A Statistical Region is any area of the earth for statistics have been or may be gathered. These include political divisions (such as countries, cities, provinces, etc.) and regions created specifically for statistical purposes, such as census areas.

Properties.Name: Agriculture (% of GDP)
Properties.Description: Net output of the Agriculture sector as percentage of GDP.

Properties.Name: Arithmetic population density (per kmÂ²)
Properties.Description: The arithmetic population density of this location, measured in people per square kilometer of land.

Properties.Name: Births
Properties.Description: The number of live births occurring during a given time period.

Properties.Name: Births Female
Properties.Description: The number of live births of female babies occurring during a given time period.

Properties.Name: Births Male
Properties.Description: The number of live births of male babies occurring during a given time period.

Properties.Name: Broadband penetration rate
Properties.Description: Number of high-speed internet connections (capacity equal or higher than 144 kbit/s) per 100 inhabitants.

Properties.Name: Inflation rate
Properties.Description: Inflation as measured by the consumer price index reflects the annual percentage change in the cost to the average consumer of acquiring a basket of goods and services that may be fixed or changed at specified intervals, such as yearly.

Properties.Name: Crude birth rate
Properties.Description: Crude birth rate indicates the number of live births occurring during the year, per 1,000 population estimated at midyear. Subtracting the crude death rate from the crude birth rate provides the rate of natural increase, which is equal to the rate of population change in the absence of migration.

Properties.Name: Crude death rate
Properties.Description: Crude death rate indicates the number of deaths occurring during the year, per 1,000 population estimated at midyear. Subtracting the crude death rate from the crude birth rate provides the rate of natural increase, which is equal to the rate of population change in the absence of migration.

Properties.Name: Deaths
Properties.Description: The number of deaths occurring during a given time period.

Properties.Name: Deaths Female
Properties.Description: The number of deaths of female individuals occurring during a given time period.

Properties.Name: Deaths Male
Properties.Description: The number of deaths of male individuals occurring during a given time period.

Properties.Name: Debt service (% of trade volume)
Properties.Description: Principal repayments and interest paid on long-term debt and interest paid on short-term debt. Trade volume includes income and workers' remittances.

Properties.Name: Deposit interest rate
Properties.Description: Deposit interest rate is the rate paid by commercial or similar banks for demand, time, or savings deposits.

Properties.Name: Electricity consumption per capita
Properties.Description: Electricity consumption in kilowatt-hours per capita.

Properties.Name: Electricity production
Properties.Description: Total annual regional electricity generated in kilowatt-hours.

Properties.Name: Energy use per capita
Properties.Description: Primary energy use (before transformation to other end-use fuels) in kilograms of oil equivalent, per capita.

Properties.Name: External debt stock
Properties.Description: Total external debt owed to nonresidents repayable in foreign currency, goods, or services.

Properties.Name: Fertility rate
Properties.Description: The average number of births per woman.

Properties.Name: GDP growth rate
Properties.Description: Percentage change of real GDP compared to previous year. Real GDP is adjusted for inflation.

Properties.Name: GDP real
Properties.Description: Gross Domestic Product at constant prices

Properties.Name: GNI in PPP dollars
Properties.Description: Gross National Income, expressed in purchasing power parity dollars to adjust for price level differences across countries. Not adjusted for inflation.

Properties.Name: GNI per capita in PPP dollars
Properties.Description: Gross National Income per capita, expressed in purchasing power parity dollars to adjust for price level differences across countries. Not adjusted for inflation.

Properties.Name: Government debt as percent of GDP
Properties.Description: General government debt as percent of Gross Domestic Product.

Properties.Name: HIV prevalence rate
Properties.Description: Prevalence of HIV is the percentage of people who are infected with HIV.

Properties.Name: Hospital beds
Properties.Description: Hospital beds include inpatient beds available in public, private, general, and specialized hospitals and rehabilitation centers. In most cases beds for both acute and chronic care are included.

Properties.Name: Industry (% of GDP)
Properties.Description: Net output of the Industry sector (Mining, Manufacturing, Utilities) as percentage of GDP.

Properties.Name: Internet users
Properties.Description: People with access to the Internet.

Properties.Name: Internet users as percentage of population
Properties.Description: People with access to the Internet per 100 inhabitants.

Properties.Name: Life expectancy
Properties.Description: The average number of years a newborn is expected to live with current mortality patterns remaining the same.

Properties.Name: Literacy rate
Properties.Description: The literacy rate is the percentage of people who can, with understanding, both read and write a short, simple statement about their everyday life.

Properties.Name: Military expenditure as percentage of GDP
Properties.Description: Military expenditure as percentage of Gross Domestic Product.

Properties.Name: Minimum wage
Properties.Description: The minimum wage of this jurisdiction, for most employees. Does not include tips, allowances, or the value of additional benefits.

Properties.Name: Natural gas production
Properties.Description: Natural gas production within the region (cubic metric volume extracted per year).

Properties.Name: Oil production
Properties.Description: Oil production of the region as measured by the quantity of crude oil extracted (not refined).

Properties.Name: Part time employment
Properties.Description: Part time employment refers to regular employment in which working time is substantially less than normal. Expressed as a percent of labour force.

Properties.Name: Population growth rate
Properties.Description: The annual population growth in this location.

Properties.Name: Primary education completion rate
Properties.Description: Total number of new entrants in the last grade of primary education, regardless of age, expressed as percentage of the total population of the theoretical entrance age to the last grade of primary.

Properties.Name: Renewable freshwater resources per capita
Properties.Description: Available renewable freshwater flows in rivers and groundwater from rainfall, in cubic meters per capita.

Properties.Name: 50th percentile rent - 0 br
Properties.Description: The 50th percentile rent for a 0 bedroom

Properties.Name: 50th percentile rent - 1 br
Properties.Description: The 50th percentile rent for a 1 bedroom

Properties.Name: 50th percentile rent - 2 br
Properties.Description: The 50th percentile rent for a 2 bedroom

Properties.Name: 50th percentile rent - 3 br
Properties.Description: The 50th percentile rent for a 3 bedroom

Properties.Name: 50th percentile rent - 4 br
Properties.Description: The 50th percentile rent for a 4 bedroom

Properties.Name: Services (% of GDP)
Properties.Description: Net output of the Service industry as percentage of GDP.

Properties.Name: Unemployment Rate
Properties.Description: The unemployment rate for this location.
